result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Gee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharges.
Court costs and victim wtiness surcharges, DNA surcharge are to be paid by 5/26/2076.  DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, and consecutive to count two. Credit for 392 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with A.M. OR J.P.  Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this Order is violated.

Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
AODA assessment and any reocmmended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also advised because he has been convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 if he possesses a firearm within five (5) years of completing his felony sentence, he will be subject to a mandatory three (3) year Inital  Confinement sentence; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Court advised the defendant that he is subject to the sex offender registry and must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements. Defendant also advised he may be subject to possible future proceedings as a Sexually Violent Person under Wisconsin Statutes Chapter 980.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, and consecutive to count one.  Credit for zero days.

Defendant Christopher L Gee in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Christopher L Gee in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
No corrections made to the PSI.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 30 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 20 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, and consecutive to Count 2, credit for 392 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 30 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 20 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, and consecutive to Count 1, credit for 0 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/26/2076, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/26/2076, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds;; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact  with AM or JP. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; Defendant also advised because he has been convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 if he possesses a firearm within 5 years of completing his felony sentence, he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement sentence; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
*Court advised the defendant that he is subject to the sex offender registry and must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements. Defendant also advised he may be subject to possible future proceedings as a Sexually Violent Person under Wisconsin Statutes Chapter 980.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Christopher L Gee in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Christopher L Gee in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

At the hour of 1:50pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to COUNTS 1 & 2 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  The Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court orders a Presentence Investigation without recommendation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher L Gee in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Christopher L Gee in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

A.M. SESSION.

CASE RECALLED.
Court address letter sent by the jury, for the court to review the jury instructions.

Defendant Christopher L Gee in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Christopher L Gee in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

AM SESSION...

JURY IN BOX.
Court orally makes correction to the offence date as to count 2.
Closing arguments by state and defense.  State's rebuttal arguments. 
Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:57am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy J. Cross and M. Kohlhapp who was duly sworn for that purpose.
WAIVER OF RIGHT TO TESTIFY, received and filed. lms

Defendant Christopher L Gee in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Christopher L Gee in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

PM SESSION...
Trial resumed.  Sworn for the state:  Olga Leider (Dept. of Justice) on direct examination.   Exhibits 64, 65, 66 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  Cross examination.  Redirect examination.

JURY OUT OF BOX.
Parties reviewed all exhibits.
Defense motions for a DISMISSAL.  State argues against.   Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.

JURY IN BOX.
State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for defense: Detective Steve Wells (MPD) on direct examination.  Cross examination.  Redirect examination.  Recross examination.  Re-redirect examination.  Re-recross examination.  Sworn for defense:  Detective Sarah Blomme (MPD) on direct examination.  Cross examination.  

JURY OUT OF BOX.
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.  Defendant has declined to sign the waiver.
Parties reviewed the jury instructions.

JURY IN BOX.
Defense rest.  State has no rebuttal.  Testimony closed.  
Closing instructions of the law is read in open court.  Court released the jurors for the evening and instructed them to report to court 4/1/2016 at 8:30am.

JURY OUT OF BOX.
State request court make corrections to the offense date as to count 2, per the closing instructions.

Parties dismissed.  Trial to resume 4/1/2016 at 8:30am in br. 15.
  Jury trial scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher L Gee in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Christopher L Gee in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin with court officer Detective Geri Lin Dun.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

AM SESSION...
After hearing arguments from both parties, Court will not allow prior inconsistent statements of a witnesss and places reasons on the record.

JURY IN BOX AT 9:20AM.
Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Detective Geri Lin Dun (MPD)on direct examination.   Exhibits 81, 82, 83 offered into evidence by State, received by the courts and published to the jury.  Cross examination.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Matthew Bughmin lin Dun on direct examination.   Exhibits 60 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  No cross examination.  Sworn for the State:  Officer Ronald Villagonez (MPD) on direct examination.   Cross examination.  Sidebar discussion held.

JURY OUT OF BOX.
Sidebar placed on the record  State is waiting for the arrival of a witness.  Parties discuss Closing instructions and other minor trial concerns.   Court took a brief break.

JURY IN BOX AT 10:11AM.
Sworn for the state:  Officer Joan Mueller (MPD) on direct examination.   Exhibits 70, 33, 54, 72, 71 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  Cross examination.  Redirect examination.  Brief recross examination.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Brian Maciejewski (MPD) on direct examination.  No cross.  Sworn for the state:  Detective Sean Lips (MPD) on direct examination.   Exhibits 58 & 59 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  No cross examination.  Sworn for the state:  Detective Timoth Wallich (MPD) on direct examination.   Exhibit 62 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  Sidebar discussions held in judge's chambers.  

Court released the jury early for lunch due to scheduling.

JURY OUT OF BOX.
Sidebar is placed on the record.

Private Vior Dire held with juror #24.

Court recessed for lunch.  All parties instructed to report back at 1:00pm for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

P.M....CASE RECALLED.....SAME APPEARANCES.....

Trial resumed.  Jury in at 1:32 p.m. Sworn for the state: Senior Forensic Analyst Olga Spichenok (State Crime Laboratory).  Exhibit #64-66 offered by the state and received into evidence.  Sworn for the state:  Detective Sean Lips (Milwaukee Police Department).  Exhibit #58 and 59 fully admitted into evidence.  Sworn for the state:  Detective Timothy Wallich (Milwaukee Police Department).  Exhibit # 62, 63, 67.  Sworn for the state: Police Officer Trisha Klauser (Milwaukee Police Department).  Exhibit #68 and 39 offered by the state and received into evidence.  Sworn:  Police Officers Brian Maciejewski and Joan Mueller (Milwaukee Police Department).  Exhibit #70-72 offered by the state and received into evidence.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense makes motion to dismiss without argument.  The state's argument heard.  The Court denies motion to dismiss.  Court in recess to allow defense to confer with defendant.  Trial resumed.  Defense indicates that the defendant will not testify.  The Court holds colloquy with defendant as to right to remain testify/right to remain silent.  Instruction conference conducted with counsel.  Waiver of Right to Testify accepted by the Court, waiver received and filed.  Jury in at 4:40 p.m. and released for the day at 4:43 p.m.  Case adjourned to 12-04-15 at 8:30 a.m. for Jury Trial before Branch 17.
